sen.j: 水没する梅林を補償するため、移植可能な古木を現在の月ヶ瀬尾山天神の森付近や月ヶ瀬嵩三山付近に移植した。
sen.e: In order to save the submerging Bairin, some transplantable old trees were moved to the area around Mt. Tsukigaseoyama Tenjin-no Mori Forest and Mt. Tsukigasedake miyama.
sen.cmt: 三山→読み方不明(miyama)と訳しています。
sen.e: In order to save the submerging plum groves, some transplantable old trees were moved to the area around Mt. Tsukigaseoyama Tenjin-no Mori Forest and the three mountains surrounding Mt. Tsukigasedake.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。三山は「大和三山」と解釈しました。bairinをplum grovesに変えました。
sen.e: In order to save the submerging plum groves, some transplantable old trees were moved to the area around Mt. Tsukigaseoyama Tenjin-no Mori Forest and the three mountains surrounding Mt. Tsukigasedake.

sen.j: また、月瀬村内各所に新たな梅林が設けられた。
sen.e: Also, new Bairins were created in various places of Tsukigase Village.
Also, new plum groves were planted in various places around Tsukigase Village.
sen.cmt: bairinをplum groveにしました。createdをplantedにしました。ofをaroundにしました。
sen.e: Also, new plum groves were planted in various places around Tsukigase Village.

sen.j: また、梅林を保護する立場である月ヶ瀬保勝会は戦中戦後の混乱から休眠状態に陥っていたが、新生月ヶ瀬梅林を盛り立てるために活動を再開した。
sen.e: Emerged from the dormant state during the wartime and postwar turmoil, Tsukigase Hoshokai resumed its operation to support the new Tsukigase Bairin.
Emerging from the dormant state it had fallen into during the war and postwar turmoil, Tsukigase Hoshokai resumed its operation to support the new Tsukigase Bairin.

sen.e: Emerging from the dormant state it had fallen into during the war and postwar turmoil, Tsukigase Hoshokai resumed its operation to support the new Tsukigase Bairin.

sen.j: 高山ダム工事中には、水没する前の月ヶ瀬の姿を一目見るために多くの観光客が押し寄せた。
sen.e: During the construction of Takayama Dam, many tourists visited the site to have one last look at the landscape of Tsukigase before being gulped by water.
During the construction of Takayama Dam, many tourists visited the site to take one last look at the landscape of Tsukigase before being swallowed up by water.

sen.e: During the construction of Takayama Dam, many tourists visited the site to take one last look at the landscape of Tsukigase before being swallowed up by water.

sen.j: 最盛期には1日当たり2 - 3万人の観光客で賑わった。
sen.e: 20,000 to 30,000 tourists visited the village a day at its peak.
At its peak, 20,000 to 30,000 tourists visited each day.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。順序を変えました。
sen.e: At its peak, 20,000 to 30,000 tourists visited each day.

sen.j: ちょうど自家用車が普及し始めた時代であり、駐車場不足により中学校の校庭を駐車場に開放せざるを得ない状況であったという。
sen.e: It was the time when people started owning a car, the village had to use the playground of a junior high school as an extra parking space to compensate the lack of parking lot.
It was the time when people had started owning their own cars, and the village had to use the playground of a local junior high school to compensate for the lack of parking.

sen.e: It was the time when people had started owning their own cars, and the village had to use the playground of a local junior high school to compensate for the lack of parking.

sen.j: 高山ダムは1969年に完成し、五月川の渓谷は月ヶ瀬湖に変貌した。
sen.e: Takayama Dam was completed in 1969, and the Satsuki River Valley was replaced by Lake Tsukigase.
Takayama Dam was completed in 1969, and the Satsuki River Valley was replaced by Lake Tsukigase.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Takayama Dam was completed in 1969, and the Satsuki River Valley was replaced by Lake Tsukigase.

sen.j: 渓谷が沈んだ後も月ヶ瀬梅林では月ヶ瀬梅渓保勝会や観光協会による梅林の管理保全、移植梅樹や幼木梅の育成が続けられている。
sen.e: Even after the Valley was submerged under water, Tsukigase Baikei hoshokai and tourist associations continue their efforts to manage and protect Tsukigase Bairin and foster transplanted or young plum trees.

Even though the valley has gone under water, Tsukigase Baikei Hoshokai and tourist associations continue their efforts to manage and protect Tsukigase Bairin and foster transplanted or young plum trees.

sen.e: Even though the valley has gone under water, Tsukigase Baikei Hoshokai and tourist associations continue their efforts to manage and protect Tsukigase Bairin and foster transplanted or young plum trees.

sen.j: また、月ヶ瀬梅林は1975年には奈良県立月ヶ瀬神野山自然公園の一部に指定された。
sen.e: Also, Tsukigase Bairin was designated a part of Nara Prefectural Tsukigase Konoyama Natural Park in 1975.

sen.e: Tsukigase Bairin was designated a part of Nara Prefectural Tsukigase Konosan Natural Park in 1975.

sen.j: 名阪国道の開通や都道府県道・広域農道の整備などにより交通事情が改善したこともあり、1988年には推定観光客10万人以上を見込める観光地となっている。
sen.e: As opening of Meihan National Rout and improved prefectural roads and wide-area farm road contributed to the better traffic conditions, Tsukigase has grown to be the tourist spot which expects more than 100,000 tourists in 1988.

The opening of the Meihan Expressway and improved prefectural roads and wide farm roads have contributed to better traffic conditions, Tsukigase has grown to be a tourist destination which expected more than 100,000 tourists in 1988.

sen.e: The opening of the Meihan Expressway and improved prefectural roads and wide farm roads have contributed to better traffic conditions, Tsukigase has grown to be a tourist destination which expected more than 100,000 tourists in 1988.

sen.j: 今では月ヶ瀬湖の湖水と育成した梅樹が調和し、新生月ヶ瀬梅林が観光客の目を楽しませている。
sen.e: Today, the lake water of Lake Tsukigase and grown plum trees coexist in harmony, and the newborn Tsukigase Bairin provides beautiful landscape to tourists.
Today, Lake Tsukigase and grown plum trees compliment each other perfectly, and tourists enjoy the amazing beauty of the newborn Tsukigase Bairin.
